page.title: 10Silverton Park Farm
page.content: This 320 acre{farm}is owned by Mr. Alford. He rises at 7.30 a.m. to organise his men and to sort out the electric fencing. His haymaking was adversely affected by the recent rain. He owns a herd of pedigree Friesian cows, 5 bulls, 1 dog and 1 cat. He has 4 children, 1 of whom wants to farm part of the land when older.These days there is a need to specialise and so he no longer keeps sheep and pigs. A cow should calve once a year, his last calf being born on Sunday. The {milk}is cooled to 40 degrees ready for piping into the lorry to take it to the depot. The milk is weighed once a month for quality checks. Milking is twice a day. We saw silage, cows' feet being dipped and registration certificates. All the feeding is controlled by {computer}and this surprised us.
